fields.description:
Currently any application links between Fisheye and Jira must be manually created. This can be a tedious process when multiple Jira projects are referenced by commit messages in multiple repositories.

Once the basic application link to Jira is set up, Fisheye is fully aware of the list of projects that Jira has. This combined with the index of commit messages that Fisheye builds should allow it to automatically create application links between Fisheye repositories and Jira projects, saving admins time and effort.

Security is covered by proper configuration of Jira project permissions schemes and per-repository access settings on the Fisheye side
fields.summary: Enable automatic repository->Jira project entity link creation

fields.description:
In P4 you can commit and then go back and edit a commit description.

In FishEye if you run an Incremental index scan on starting on the revision including that changeset having the description edited, (eg. from DRA-1 to DRA-2) the changeset isn't reflected properly in JIRA. In other words the changeset is in the wrong JIRA issue.

However, if you run a full Re-index the correct changeset is properly reflected in the issue. In other words the changeset moves to the correct JIRA issue.

It takes to long to index some repositories in P4 so this has to get fixed.

Steps to reproduce:

# Commit a changeset with a description of DRA-1.
# Notice the changeset is reflected in DRA-1.
# Edit the description of the changeset in P4 to DRA-2.
# Run an incremental index starting from that revision having the changeset.
# Notice in JIRA the DRA-1 Source tab shows the changeset.
# Run a full Re-index.
# Notice the changeset is in the proper Source Tab.
fields.summary: An Incremental Source Index does not update the Source Tab Properly

fields.description: We have the feature to set a proxy/credentials within it JIRA to tunnel through our company proxy and get to the atlassian plugin marketplace. I would like to see it in Fisheye/crucible. The instructions given to use the OS level proxy just don't always work right, or are sometimes feasible in the environment.
fields.summary: Add built-in support for use of proxy to contact external plugins site

fields.description: I would like to request a feature to allow you add a category to the repository list. Like Jira, we have a lot of Repositories that will be maintained in Fisheye. We can limit who can see what repositories through the permissions, however if a user has access to multiple business unit repositories I would like to see a Category or Group to help lessen the clutter.
fields.summary: Add Project support to FishEye

fields.description:
Right now it is possible to grant permissions based on groups.
A customer would like to grant access based on user instead
fields.summary: Grant Fisheye permission based on user

fields.description: If you set a filter on the activity tab, then click a path in the file tree, the filter no longer applies
fields.summary: Filter is not preserved when you click on a path in the file tree

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Current revision in subversion = 12000+

1. Let fisheye index from a specific revision, let's say 9000.
2. svn copy from the trunk to a tag. This will be revision 12125. (Screenshot 1)
3. Commit a change into a file of the tag. This will be revision 12227. (Screenshot 2). Note: This file is not newly added, but modified!
4. Browse fisheye source to this changed file. Hit the diff link on revision screen (Screenshot 3)

Expected: A diff link, providing a diff between revision 12125 & 12227 
Actual: No diff link present

5. Commit yet another change to the same file in the same tag. This will be revision 12259

Expected: Diff between revision 12227 & 12259
Actual: Revision/Activity (tab) screen is shown again.

6. Browse to the source towards the changed file, view revision tab (Screenshot 4)

Expected: Commit of file seen in revision tab (revision 12125 & 12227)
Actual: Revision of file is missing!
fields.summary: FishEye is missing diffs for files modified on a tag

fields.description:
{code}
Your request was unable to be processed
org.hibernate.exception.JDBCConnectionException - Cannot open connection
Cannot open connection
Communications link failure The last packet successfully received from the server was 399.055 milliseconds ago. The last packet sent successfully to the server was 0 milliseconds ago.
Can not read response from server. Expected to read 4 bytes, read 0 bytes before connection was unexpectedly lost.
{code}

The MySQL server closes the connection after 60 seconds idle time which causes a Cannot open connection exception. 

It seems it is similar to the described Jira issue here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Surviving+Connection+Closures .

Here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15731 as well.

Unfortunately our shop cannot set db server settings.

This is causing us serious problems.
fields.summary: FishEye isn't resetting closed connections

fields.description:
A complicated series of moves and copies results in history not being shown for a file on a branch.

After indexing the attached repo, with the repository settings shown below, the URL http://localhost:6060/foo/browse/fsh9201/branches/projects/trn93/src/us/ic/foo.txt only shows revision 12.

Repo settings:
{noformat}
<repository name="fsh9201" description="" store-diff="true" enabled="true"><svn url="file:///Users/tomd/tmp/fsh9201" path="" follow-base="false" initial-import="none"><symbolic auto-rules="true"><trunk regex="trunk(/|$)" name="trunk" logical=""/><branch regex="branches/([^/]+)/([^/]+)" name="${1}-${2}" logical="${2}"/><tag regex="tags/([^/]+)/([^/]+)" name="${1}-${2}" logical="${2}"/></symbolic></svn>
      <linker/><security use-defaults="true" allow-anon="false" allow-logged-in="false" allow-anon-write="false" allow-logged-in-write="false"><required-groups/><required-write-groups/></security>
</repository>
{noformat}
fields.summary: Files can lose history when copied from tags to branches

fields.description:
To increase performance of Activity Streams, we no longer do 3 searches to render the page:
* one for the stream
* then another 2 to see which of the next/previous arrows need displaying.

One solution is to instead provide a "More" button at the bottom of each activity stream, which will simply fetch the next 25 (50?) activity items from the server, and display them all on the same page.

Things to consider:
* we could still support the existing URL parameters to maintain compatability with any existing links
* we should audit all links in fisheye to ensure there are none already pointing to a streams search which has timestamp bounds
* e.g. the View in Activity Stream link on the changeset page, will need to still work - we will possibly need a similar "More" ajaxified link at the top of the stream too ?
fields.summary: Fix Activity Stream paging (possibly with Ajaxified, infinite scroll or similar)

fields.description: A bad branch name causes Hg scanning to stop. Solution is to be more defensive when getting list of commits for a branch.
fields.summary: Hg scanning chokes on invalid branch name

fields.description:
This issue is derived from FE-1745. Here is the suggestion made by the user:

Approach1 - using "between"

{panel}
select revisions from dir 
where comment matches "H152318" and between csid [94223, 94504]
group by changeset return path, revision, author, date, csid
{panel}

Approach2 - using "<", ">", ...

{panel}
select revisions from dir / where comment matches "H152318" 
and csid >= 94223 and csid <= 94504 
group by changeset return path, revision, author, date, csid
{panel}
see logged issue FSH-3163
fields.summary: Allow users to get a list of revisions between two csids
Blitz-test pages changed in admin UI due to radio button issues/changes

fields.description:
Just today we noticed that clicking the applinks menu option for any repository results in the following error message:
{noformat}
No entity exists with key appdev of type com.atlassian.applinks.api.application.fecru.FishEyeRepositoryEntityType
Status code: 400
{noformat}

All of our repositories are restricted by LDAP filters.
The error only appears for those repositories where I'm not a member of the LDAP group with repository access.
Given that only Fisheye admins would be able to add applinks, it seems like Fisheye is looking in the wrong place for permissions (repo-view permissions instead of admin permissions)
fields.summary: Getting "No entity exists with key <REPONAME> of type com.atlassian.applinks.api.application.fecru.FishEyeRepositoryEntityType" editing clicking applinks for a repository

fields.description:
Encoding of asian characters + accented characters in email subject doesn't seem to work properly (e.g. àáâãäåçèéêëìíîðñòôõöö国際交流基金海外運営専門 

came out as �焔褐刻諮蒼樗?迄剱囹???????????? in the email subject
fields.summary: Encoding of asian characters + accented characters in email subject doesn't seem to work properly

fields.description: Files with a ? in the name can not be viewed in FishEye.  The file name IS being properly urlencoded in links, but at some point in the chain of processing the request - after it has been urldecoded - everything after the ? is lost.
fields.summary: Fisheye can not handle files with a '?' in the name

fields.description:
It is possible that fisheye's clone of a remote repo won't contain any git stashes that exist in the remote repo, but fisheye will still expect them to be there when it scans the repository's refs.

Preliminary attempts to reproduce this with simple cases were unsuccessful, more investigation is required to reproduce.

Find out why the git stash appears to be cloned sometimes and not others.

Fix this in Fisheye so that it filters any git stashes out of the refs it tries to scan.
fields.summary: Git Stashes in remote repos aren't cloned but fisheye can still see them

fields.description:
{{Administration > <REPO_NAME> > Updates > ?}} currently reads:
bq. How often FishEye will check to see if there have been any new commits into the SVN or Perforce repository. The default is 60 seconds. It is possible to set the period by units. For example: 10second, 1week. Valid units are 'second', 'minute', 'hour', 'day', 'week', 'month', 'year'. The default unit is days if only a number is added.

This text needs to include Git.
fields.summary: Polling Interval help text on screen needs to be updated

fields.description:
Make it possible in FishEye to mirror an external services configuration (Stash, Bitbucket, Github...)

Instead of having to replicate the repositories in FishEye you would have a process automatically detecting newly created repositories and index them in FishEye.
fields.summary: Add integration with external services

fields.description:
- Setup JIRA/Crowd Authentication to sync one JIRA group (e.g. jira-users)
- Create a group in JIRA containing no members
- Re-sync and note that the group is visible in FECRU (Administration > Security Settings > Groups)

I would expect a sync with one JIRA group to only pull over that group and its users and additionally any other groups those users are members of.
fields.summary: JIRA User Authentication Sync Pulls Over All JIRA Groups Regardless

fields.description:
I have FeCru authentication to JIRA User server. A group called WAY_MORE_JUNK comes over when I sync. When I try to add a user in FeCru to that group, I get the following: 

Your request was unable to be processed
com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException - Group 'WAY_MREJUNK' does not exist
.

See the screenshot.
fields.summary: Adding a user to a group that gets pulled over from a JIRA User server causes an exception

fields.description:
If you leave the fisheye.out or fisheye-error log files unattended they can grow to be quite large (a customer reported having 158gb console log file). We should update the logging so that the files get rolled over regularly.

h2. Workaround

h3. Rotate fisheye.out file
See [Configuring+FishEye+to+rotate+the+console+log+file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Configuring+FishEye+to+rotate+the+console+log+file] or

h3. Disable console appender in log4j config file

Edit the log4j.xml and log4j-client.xml files and remove {{<appender name="console" class="org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender">}} sections.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I want the FishEye Console and error logs to roll over regularly, so that they are easier to open and check

fields.description: Configure an application links (e.g. JIRA) with Incoming Authentication > Basic Access and although it is successful with Status "Configured" it shows "none" on the "Application Links" page. See attached images.
fields.summary: Incoming Authentication shows "none" when in fact it is configured

fields.description:
When a file is copied from an excluded path to an included path, FIsheye detects this as an add instead of a copy (this is correct behaviour) but it also potentially detects the file as a directory.

{code}
2012-07-02 14:36:30,902 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [ST]: Creating changeset 299 - processing addition application/trunk/src/modules/db/sqlDataDBObject.cc
2012-07-02 14:36:30,911 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app AllowRules-isIgnored - Excluding path '/application/branches' by pattern: AntGlob<application/branches,cs=false>
2012-07-02 14:36:30,912 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [ST]: Creating changeset 299 - processing addition application/trunk/src/modules/db/sqlDataDBObject.hh
2012-07-02 14:36:30,931 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryWalker-walkDir - Walking filesystem application/trunk/src/modules/db/sqlDataDBObject.hh
2012-07-02 14:36:30,931 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryWalker-walkDir - Getting info for svn://172.20.3.31/repo/application/trunk/src/modules/db/sqlDataDBObject.hh@299
2012-07-02 14:36:30,931 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app SvnThrottledClient-start - Executing info -r 299 svn://172.20.3.31/repo/application/trunk/src/modules/db/sqlDataDBObject.hh@299
2012-07-02 14:36:30,972 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [ST]: Creating changeset 299 - processing modification application/trunk/src/modules/db/sql.hh
2012-07-02 14:36:30,982 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [ST]: Creating changeset 299 - processing modification application/trunk/src/modules/db/sql.cc
2012-07-02 14:36:30,994 DEBUG [InitialPinger1 ST] fisheye.app RepositoryStatus-setMessage - Status change [ST]: Created changeset 299
{code}

This can also occur if a file in the tag hasn't been changed since before the start reviison on the repository.  For example:
1. file test.txt created in trunk in revision 3
2. Several other commits created in other files in trunk but not test.txt
3. Start revision in fisheye is set to revision 5
4. trunk is copied to a tag in revision 10
5. test.txt will be picked up as a directory
fields.summary: For SVN, when a file is copied from an excluded path to an included path, it can be incorrectly recognised as a directory

fields.description:
I would like a suggested route to basically:

1. Backup another departments fisheye/crucible (2.4.4)
2. Create our own instance/mysql database and import their data into it
3. upgrade our instance to 2.7.14

I assume that is the basic steps or only route, IE i can't restore directly into 2.7.x or 2.8.x

If i have the exact same version instance as they do, can i import a backup from their instance. Do i have to unpack it and modify the config.xml, and or a bunch of other things to reflect the new mysql database, credentials, ldap credentials, etc..

We will be assuming the site license as well
fields.summary: Recommendation for assuming administration of another instance of fish/crucible

fields.description:
FishEye currenly only supports Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP). It would be nice if FishEye also support NTML Authentication for sending authentication data.

The NT LAN Manager (NTLM) Authentication: (SMTP) Extension uses the SMTP-AUTH command (as specified in [RFC2554] section 4) and SMTP response codes to negotiate NTLM authentication and send authentication data.
fields.summary: Support NTLM

fields.description:
These exceptions have been reported in a support case:

{code}
[snip]
2012-06-25 03:30:43,856 DEBUG [main ] fisheye.app P4Exec-getProcessStatusMessage - Exception processing P4 command - returning as status
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 1
        at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.complete(PluggableProcessHandler.java:83)
[snip]
{code}
(new in 2.7.14, not seen on 2.7.10)

and
{code}

fisheye.app P4Exec-getProcessStatusMessage - Exception processing P4 command - returning as status
com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 1
        at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.complete(PluggableProcessHandler.java:83)
        at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl.finish(ExternalProcessImpl.java:308)
        at com.atlassian.utils.process.ExternalProcessImpl.execute(ExternalProcessImpl.java:351)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.perforce.client.P4Exec.login(P4Exec.java:131)
{code}
(Seen since at least 2.7.7)

Investigate if these error messages are spurious over-reporting that occur as part of normal perforce operation (most likely) or if they potentially indicate a problem.  If they are spurious, determine if we can catch the specific exception and just log a message saying what perforce said and what it means, rather than a full stack trace,
fields.summary: Investigate spurious log messages for perforce

fields.description: [This documentation page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Users+appear+deleted+after+upgrading+to+FishEye+2.7.X] contains scripts for merging data for _old1 users for mysql, postgres, and sql server.  Scripts need to be written for Oracle.
fields.summary: Create Oracle user data merge scripts

fields.description:
When browsing code, blank lines appear and the progress indicator can be seen through them. Please see the screenshot for reference.

Some comments:

- The progress indicator is live (its colors are changing).
- The problem did never appear on Fisheye 2.6.6
- The problem happens when it is Firefox (v12) that is being used.
- The problem does NOT happen when it is Internet Explore (v9) that is being used.
- The kind of repository the code is in doesn't seem to matter (the problem takes place viewing code in a CVS repo as well as code in a SVN one).
fields.summary: When browsing code in Firefox, blank lines appear and the progress indicator can be seen through it

Where:
- Commit Messages
- Review "Objectives" field

2012-06-24 19:36:49,167 DEBUG [FE-WatchChecker ] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-release - release engine on FEP, count=1
2012-06-24 19:36:49,220 DEBUG [CommitNotifier1 ] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-release - release engine on FEP, count=0
{code}

The Entity Links for FEP definitely appear to be configured.
If this was the result of a permission issue, I would expect to see another log message explaining what permission is missing and for whom.


I am going to add a workaround fix for this, which will log an error when there is any exception thrown during rendering of a commit message, yet still send the watch email, with the commit message not wiki rendered.


I will also be looking into how this situation can occur.
fields.summary: Watch Emails throwing exception in certain circumstances

fields.description:
It is possible in JIRA to use customized keys for the project. In this case the Smart Commits are not working as the pattern used for the key (underscore for example) is not matched by the regular expression recognizing JIRA keys.

This feature would provide a way to match customized JIRA keys. It would probably require to store on the FishEye the different patterns used and synch them to stay up-to-date in case they are modified.

There are also some concerns around the fact that the JIRA FishEye plugin could catch words and expressions that are not supposed to be issues if we go down that path.
fields.summary: Support Smart Commits with customized JIRA keys

fields.description: Git Commit processing currently creates an object to represent the commit before processing it. Extremely large commits can cause memory problems). Change the commit processing to stream the change paths in batches separately from the commit itself.
fields.summary: Git Commit processing should stream paths

fields.description:
I tried to migrate my users from built-in to JIRA/Crowd and noticed they still show deleted in the reviews.

# Add a built-in user to a review
# Delete the user
# Add that same user to JIRA/Crowd
# Sync the directory
# Notice the JIRA/Crowd user comes over but the review the original user was participating in shows deleted

It would be nice if the transition to JIRA/Crowd allowed for such king of behavior and not show in the review the user is deleted.
fields.summary: Allow admins to modify auth type

fields.description:
I watch the repository that I work on so that I am notified of all changes by other team members.

I can't seem to configure it to not email me about my own changes, though.
fields.summary: Don't email the author about their own changes

fields.description:
Every FeCru repo sends a REST call to Crowd with a "getUserInfo" function (GET /rest/usermanagement/1/user?username=aaa_user).

It would be nice if there was only 1 such call as this would speed things up.

I have JIRA delegating user management to LDAP
I have FeCru authenticating to JIRA
I have integrated JIRA with FeCru
Set up 2 or more repos, set up 2 ore more project link in JIRA to FishEye
Each time you click "Source" tab in JIRA you will see in the debug logs with network traffic clicked
fields.summary: Every FeCru repo sends a REST call to Crowd with  a getUserInfo function when the source tab is clicked in JIRA

fields.description:
Currently, FeCru does not have an API that can return the results for all the repos at once. It would be nice if there was such API as the performance would be better.


Most important here is to ensure that performance and scaling is high. A testing strategy (large (1000) number of repos) is therfore required. 

Must talk to Brendan about how to most efficiently build the security constraint.
fields.summary: Implement a REST endpoint that can return the results for all the repos at once. This will be used by the JIRA FishEye Plugin.

fields.description:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-4146

Could we mention this in our existing documentation? Is this a standard practice for our Docs teams?
fields.summary: Include related bugs in Documentation: Smart Commits with underscores

fields.summary: Smart commits not working for JIRA projects with custom keys that have digits in it

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a REST API call to stop or start a repository. 

EDIT: 
And for other re-indexing functions as well, e.g.: 
- Review-revision re-index
fields.summary: Extend REST API to include starting and stopping a repository and to allow for re-indexing

fields.description: I have test my JIRA & FeCru with Smart commits. If I have a project with an _ in the project key via customization the smart commits do not work. With projects that do not have an underscore they work just fine.
fields.summary: Smart commits do not work with projects that have customized JIRA key containing an _ underscore

fields.description: It would be nice to allow for smart commits processing while doing the initial indexing.
fields.summary: Process smart commits while doing the initial index

fields.description: If you customize the JIRA Project Key Pattern to contain an "_" underscore, the issues don't show up in FeCru dashboard issue tab.
fields.summary: Customized JIRA Project Key with a Pattern containing an underscore "_" does not show up in activity stream

fields.description: It will be great if customers were able to change the page that opens after login. They could be able to customize this option choosing between differentes options as dashboard, repository source, project, etc.
fields.summary: Set repository Source to show when i login to fisheye

fields.description:
In the log4j.xml we allow for setting the location of the log files.

It would be nice to have the ability to also specify the location of the support zip.
fields.summary: Support zip location configurable

fields.description:
When comparing files with "side-by-side" view, the button "Next difference" doesn't work after 2 or 3 clicks under Firefox 7, Firefox 13.0 and IE 8.0.6001.18702CO
It works perfectly under Chrome 18.0.1025.162
fields.summary: Problem with "Next difference" button and "side-by-side" view

fields.description:
If I'm reading it correctly, this has been running for 5 minutes on the stash repo on EAC: "/usr/bin/git whatchanged --always --reverse --date-order -m --no-abbrev -C --find-copies-harder 82cc50fc09c7e3cea29aa2134ba23904f8bb75c2 --pretty=format:C:%H%nP:%P%nA:%aN%nE:%aE%nR:%cN%nF:%cE%nD:%at%nS:%s%nB:%b%n@@fe_body_end@@"
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/admin/admin.do#repositories-view-stash
ah just finished
335451ms though




====

It appears that whenever you push a new branch/tag in the Stash repo, FishEye now needs > 5 minutes to catch up.
I just pushed a new branch with a single new changeset
/usr/bin/git whatchanged --always --reverse --date-order -m --no-abbrev -C --find-copies-harder 7a5884dae370371bd4467cc7be0da8c82f9f8818 --pretty=format:C:%H%nP:%P%nA:%aN%nE:%aE%nR:%cN%nF:%cE%nD:%at%nS:%s%nB:%b%n@@fe_body_end@@"
Michael Heemskerk
Jun-14 9:15 AM
The issue is that this command calculates the manifest changes for ALL commits. FishEye then goes and discards all but one of the returned commits
an easy fix is to add excludes to the command to exclude any commits that are already know:
/usr/bin/git whatchanged --always --reverse --date-order -m --no-abbrev -C --find-copies-harder 7a5884dae370371bd4467cc7be0da8c82f9f8818 ^master ^1.1 --pretty=format:C:%H%nP:%P%nA:%aN%nE:%aE%nR:%cN%nF:%cE%nD:%at%nS:%s%nB:%b%n@@fe_body_end@@"
on my local box that brings down the time for the whatchanged command from 4 minutes to 0.03s
fields.summary: It takes 5 minutes to index a new branch in git
Handle errors with Confluence applinks when Confluence is disabled

fields.description:
When I change the email address in JIRA/Crowd of a user, that user's email address isn't updated in FeCru.

1. Change email address in JIRA/Crowd.
2. Let the auto sync happen (I set mine to 5 minutes)
3. Email address change isn't reflected.
4. Add a user to JIRA/Crowd
5. Sync the user is added to FeCru
6. Manual sync users in FeCru
7. The user email address change is now reflected in FeCur

fields.description: Currently the auth-v1, groups-v1 and users-v1 services are only available when a Crucible license is configured. Consider moving these services to the rest-service-fecru area of the API to allow them to be used by FishEye only users.

fields.summary: Default Block size

The new Shares dialog uses a trash can icon for removing users from the list of users to share with.

As mentioned by [~bhumphreys] in the iteration demos today, we should seriously consider replace the x on the Edit Review Details page with the trash icon for consistency's sake.

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a custom authentication plugin to integrate with my company's home-grown SSO solution.  

The problem is, if the cookie I'm checking for is missing/invalid, I have to redirect the user to the SSO login page to refresh the cookie.

I see that Confluence and JIRA both provide the HttpServletResponse to custom authenticators, so it would be appropriate to do the same for FishEye.
fields.summary: Provide handle to HttpServletResponse for custom authentication plugins

fields.description:
Currently, if during a commit indexing, the Smart Commit command can't be run against JIRA, the commit will be indexed, but the Smart Commit command will never take effect.

*What we need implemented:* In the same way that FE will continue from where it stopped to index a repo if the indexing process fails or is paused, the Smart Commit feature should know what commits didn't have their commands run successfully against JIRA and try to run them again in the future.
fields.summary: If a Smart Commit command was not run successfuly against JIRA, try again in the future

fields.description: A user has a JIRA instance with 20 workflows and only about half of them have the same "Resolved" transition status with the same ID. The "Subtask Settings" section of Application Links (JIRA) only allows for one Subtask Resolution Action ID.
fields.summary: Simplify the sub-task configuration

fields.description:
Hi there.

If in FECRU I go to Admin > Application Links > and for the app link to Jira there is a link "Jira Settings" If I click it the subtask field were initially blank.

If I set them to valid values and save I can successfully now generate Jira issues from a code review. Works fine. However, in the Jira Settings window, it clearly states on the page "Leave these fields blank to disable subtasks".
 
I set the 3 fields to blank, click Save it seems to save. Then if i click the Jira Settings link again the previous 3 values are still set.

See attached screenshot for sample values I used.

Thank you in advance.

Cheers,
*Douglas Fabretti*
*Atlassian Support*
fields.summary: Fix the Subtask integration for Crucible

Clicking on "Area" in either the inset or the "Area" radio-button under "Chart types" in OPTIONS (left-hand pane) changes the Line Chart to an Area Chart but the "Area Chart" radio-button doesn't stay selected and as such the only way to get the "Line Chart" again is to click on the tab/page title link, "Charts".

View Source:
<th><input type="checkbox" id="userSelector" title="Select/deselect all users"></th>
fields.summary: "Select/deselect all users" Checkbox Not Visible

fields.description:
{{CommitterUserMappingManager.getUserForCommitter()}} expensively calculates implicit mappings by calling {{userManager.getFishEyeUsers()}}. The result is cached, but this was still observed to account for 5.3% of rendering time of the Anon homepage on an AtlasEye demotion.

Options to fix include any combination of the follow:

1. On top of caching, implicit mappings should potentially be stored in the db.

2. calculate implicit mappings at index time and store them.

3. rewrite the implicit mapping searcher to use direct HQL to find a relevant user, rather than loading the entire user list.
fields.summary: Implicit committer mappings are potentially expensively computed multiple times on every request

fields.description:

fields.description:
What is one of the most annoying "bug" still reported a thousands time to me but I'm not able to find it here:
Pressing Cmd / Ctrl - F in the Browser and do a "browser based search" for a specific keyword in the sourcecode view, not all but first results are given.

When you first scroll up to end of the code and then doing the same thing, all results are given and iterable via CMD / Crtrl - G (Firefox).

Seems like there is some "page loader" functionalities for "performance improvement" but it's more annoying than helpful.

Perhaps it might be resolved with a correct in-source search: FE-2440
fields.summary: In-Browser Search (Cmd / Ctrl - F) not working in SourceCode view

fields.description:
Issues reported at Support show that very big repositories cause "general performance problems" in FeCru.

For instance:
*Repository:* P4, 22GB in disk, 48,000+ revisions
*Indexes in Fisheye:* hundreds of GBs (as shown in "ls -laR" result for the /var/caches/ folder)
*Consequences:* Every call in FeCru is slow. Even users that don't have stars or favorites, and never created any content, have slow responses. 

*Usual Workaround*: Instead of creating a single FeCru repo pointing to a huge repo server, create multiple repos that point to different smaller parts of the repository server.
fields.summary: Investigate and Fix performance issues for instance with very big repositories

fields.description:
We have files in the format:
NSObject+JSON.m as is quite popular for Cocoa development.

Trying to select such file in fisheye generates an error. The actual content of the file is properly displayed underneath the error.
fields.summary: Trying to browse a file name containing a + generates an error
XY Chart on Report "Review Coverage Overview" Contradicts Pie Chart

fields.description:
This is due to an extra security check added to FishEye when retrieving entity links.

The existing Smart Commits plugin was not looking up the available entity links for a repo in the context of a user.
fields.summary: If Anon Access is OFF, smart commits that interact with JIRA will not work

fields.description:
Overlapping label text in FishEye UI {{Administration >> Security Settings >> Authentication >> JIRA/Crowd Authentication}} makes it almost impossible to read the page using:

Internet Explorer 9 (IE9)
Version: 9.0.8112.16421
Update: 9.0.5
fields.summary: Overlapping Label Text in FishEye UI Using Internet Explorer (IE9)

fields.description:
We have a stand-alone installation of FishEye (v2.7.13), and I've just noticed that on the Commit Graph, JIRA issue keys that are surrounded by [] characters do not get linked properly.

For example, some of our SVN commit logs might look like:

[TAG-576] Added great new feature

Then, looking at the corresponding commit in the FishEye Commit Graph, the issue is not liked to JIRA.

All other keys that are not surrounded by [] are picked up fine.

Also, The [] surrounded keys are picked up fine on other pages in FishEye, and are picked up in all pages on JIRA too.
fields.summary: Commit graph does not link to JIRA issue if the key is surrounded by [ ]

fields.description: I would like to exclude svn tag/keyword changes (something like "$Id: Last changed: ... $) in the changeset diff view.
fields.summary: Ability to exclude SVN tag/keyword changes

fields.description: When I am using the Source->Search view and I am entering no search criteria, no changesets are displayed. I would expect to get all changesets belonging to the selected path.
fields.summary: When searching entering no search criteria should result in all changesets belong to the selected path

fields.description:
*PROBLEM*
A user reports that modifying "Time Spent" on a Crucible review with Time Tracking submission from reviews set to ON causes a timeout and error message using 2.7.12 where this was not the case in 2.7.11.

Modifying the "Time Spent" on a review ordinarily takes two Ajax calls:
reviewUpdatedAjax	
updateTimeTrackingAjax	

Toggling on "Allow Time Tracking submission from review" under Options from {{Administration >> Global Settings >> Application Links >> JIRA Settings}} causes a large number of calls to updateJiraTimeAjax!default.


*ACTIONS / NOTES*

I duplicated this locally on my machine (Version:2.7.12 Build:20120322030402 2012-03-22) and found 118 calls. I duplicated the large number of calls but not the timeout nor error message. I don't think I'm seeing either of these symptoms because both of my servers are on the same box (but this is just my guess). Results extracted from debug logs are below for 2.7.12. I tried to find logs for 2.7.11 but couldn't figure out why the calls weren't being logged and thus had to manually count them (20 calls to *updateJiraTimeAjax*) via the developer tools Chrome add on (similar to the user's screenshots).

My browser:
Chrome 19.0.1084.46 m

User's browser:
TBD

fields.description: When a Git tag is processed, the tag may include paths which have been excluded from FishEye's scan. Currently these paths trigger a search for a changeset which contains the content hash id but these will not be found. The search can take a significant amount of time.
fields.summary: Git tagging ignores file exclusions

fields.description: Our development process produces an image for each commit (using [lolcommits|https://github.com/mroth/lolcommits]). It would be a fantastic feature if these per-commit images could be seen from the associated changeset page. This could be supported simply with the ability to alter the changeset html template, for example to add {{}}.
fields.summary: Support per-commit images

fields.description: Nowadays PostgreSQL 9.1 is not a supported version. Some customers are starting to use this version (released 2011 september) so maybe we should ensure that will be supported.
fields.summary: Support for PostgreSQL 9.1

fields.description:
Hello there.

We think this is an un-realistic limitation to put on the small business / starter licence.

If another person on our team leaves and we have to relace them then we will not be able to comtinue using the software because the list of committers will become 11 (despite the same number of peole requiring access to and using the software).

Can I suggest that the limitation of 10 commmiters is modified so that the svn revision only shows data for the last 10 commiters (with others shown as unknown / legacy) whilst the software continues to function correctly with details associated with the most recent 10 comiters being available, alternatively you could enable the starter licence to only show unpdates in the last 24 months with previous updates being unavailable for review.

There must be some other way you can limit the software other than based on total commiters identified (note: looking at various online forums I can see that I am not the only person experiencing these kinds of problems).

Thank you in advance.

Cheers,
*Douglas Fabretti*
*Atlassian Support*
fields.summary: FishEye Starter License -  Commiters Limit

fields.summary: /listChangesets REST API returns 500 HTTP Status code when repo is not running

fields.description:
see: CWD-2833 .

The version of crowd client we are using has no socket timeout set.

This means that if crowd goes down, after a connection is established, fisheye/crucible could hang waiting for data.

Crowd client 2.3.x sets a socket timeout, as well as a connection timeout.
fields.summary: Upgrade crowd client to 2.3.x. Currently fisheye ships with 2.2.5.

fields.description:
* once 2.7.13 is released
* create a release containing 2.7.13 plus svn 1.7 support
* this will be a 2.8-m1 release, which will only contain svn 1.7 support
* make this available to users needing svn 1.7 support. see also: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-3819
fields.summary: Create 2.8.0-m1 release containing svn 1.7 support
view file page uses diffs/blame to render content, so is affected by indexing issues where it shouldnt be

fields.description:
Currently, our Docs state:
{quote}
*Hardware Requirements*

FishEye should ideally run on a dedicated server. The most important aspect for a large-repository deployment will be I/O speed. You definitely want a fast local HDD for FishEye's cache (not NFS or SAN).
{quote}
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Supported+Platforms

However, this is being interpreted as if "NFS or SAN work, but we don't recommend".

We need to revisit the wording and make very clear if we support it or not.
fields.summary: Revisit wording of the Hardware Supported to store FeCru data.

fields.description:
1.  Timezone "Europe/Brussels"  (logging into FishEye, then clicking on the arrow by your name in the top right corner and selecting Settings, then validating the Timezone setting).

2. selected timezome "Brussels" on operational system...
it is gmt +1
and "Automatically adjust clock for Daylight Saving Time" check-box is selected.

3. Web server setting in FishEye is Server Timezone: Europe/Brussels

When creating a comment (please see attachment) the comment displays wrong time

But if  and "Automatically adjust clock for Daylight Saving Time" check-box is *unselected* and time manually adjusted to correct local time than
the problem disappears.
fields.summary: Incorrect time indication on comment section when viewing revision details

fields.description:
This is due to the linear implementation of Activity Streams on that page.
Factors affecting performance are:
* number of stars the user has
* number of repos the user can view
* which tab is selected: All | Commits | Reviews | Issues
* status of the 'Show My Activity' checkbox

If you have no stars, and uncheck the 'Show My Activity' checkbox, then the Dashboard page should load in under 1 second.
However, the page load time will perform fairly linearly with the factors listed above.
fields.summary: Poor Dashboard page performance for logged in users

fields.description:
see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-8816

Reproduced. It seems that the returned results do not include paths that were *added* between the tag range (and any subsequent modifications to those added paths in the tag range).

To Reproduce:
1. create a simple git repo "test" with 3 files A,B,C in an initial commit
2. tag the commit "tag1"
3. add a file D and commit it
4. modify file B and commit
5. modify file D and commit
6. tag the commit "tag2"

run EyeQL: 
{code}
select revisions where 
between tags [tag1, tag2] 
group by changeset return csid, path
{code}

expecting 6 revisions, only get 4.

compare with
{code}
git log --name-only --reverse --pretty=oneline  tag1..tag2
{code}
fields.summary: EyeQL tag-range query is broken for Git repos

fields.description: The value for the LoC variable is currently stored in an INT which has a maximum positive value of 2,147,483,647 (or 2^31). A user surpassed this value and their LoC now shows a negative number. Please upgrade this variable's data type to a LONG.
fields.summary: Investigate why LoC is negative for some repositories (was: Upgrade LoC variable from an INT to a LONG)

fields.description:
This happens when a user has permission to a project, however does not have permission to the default repository in that project.

After talking to [~tim@atlassian.com], this could be fixed by checking the isAuthorized() flag on the source object returned by sourceFactory.getSource in this method in UserTextRendererTag:

{code}
protected Linker getLinker() {
        Source source = null;
        if (!StringUtils.isEmpty(repname)) {
            SourceFactory sourceFactory = SpringContext.getComponent(SourceFactory.class, "sourceFactory");
            EffectiveUserProvider effectiveUserProvider = SpringContext.getComponent(EffectiveUserProvider.class, "effectiveUserProvider");
            source = sourceFactory.getSource(repname, effectiveUserProvider.getEffectivePrincipal());
        }
        return getLinkerService().getLinker(source, project);
    }
{code}

ie. getLinkerService().getLinker() should never be called with a source instance that the current user is not authorised to view.

Also investigate why UserTextRendererTag sets the repname when rendering a project.

Note; the check may be better placed in the linker service's getLinker() method.
